myFlix Client
myFlix Client

myFlix Client

myFlix client - this project is a small front-end movie app. One version of the client side was built with React. The second version was built with Angular. Features of the app include:

  • Authentication
  • A movie card page to view movie information
  • A user profile page to view and edit movie information
  • The ability for the user to add or delete films from the user's list of favorites.

The backend of this app is based on the existing myFlix REST API database.

List of technologies: React, React Redux, Parcel, Bootstrap, Angular, Angular-CLI

Github: React client Hosted version: React
Github: Angular client Hosted version: Angular
Movie API
Movie API

Movie API

The myFlix API is the back-end for the myFlix application, the aforementioned movie directory website.

The movie API is a non-relational database; the server side includes the app's server, business logic, and business layer. The API is accessed via commonly used HTTP methods such as GET, POST, PUT and DELETE.

The backend uses combined HTTP/JWT authentication methods. The API is hosted via Heroku. Furthermore, API testing was conducted with Postman.

List of Technologies: JavaScript, Node.js, Express, MongoDB, Mongoose, Heroku, Postman

Github
Chat App
Chat App

Chat App

My chat app is a React Native mobile Application built using Expo, Gifted Chat, and Google Firebase. This chat app runs in real-time, for Android and iOS. Key features of the app include:

  • Ability for user to send images and location (location shared with map view)
  • Anonymous user authentications with Google Firebase authentication
  • Online and offline data storage via async Storage

List of technologies: React Native, Expo, Gifted-Chat library, Google Firebase

Github
Meet App
Meet App

Meet App

Meet App (a.k.a. Meat App on Github) - this project's objective is to build a serverless, progressive web app (PWA) with React while using a test driven development (TDD) technique.

The Meat App uses the Google Calendar API to fetch upcoming events. Users will be able to filter events by city, show/hide event details, specify the number of events. Furthermore, users can use the app offline. The app also provides users with visual representations of their searches in the form of graphs, which were built using the Recharts library.

List of technologies: React, Google Calendar API, AWS Lambda, Recharts

Github
Pokedex App
Pokedex App

Pokedex App

Small web application written with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. Loads data from external API and enables viewing of details for individual Pokemon upon user click.
